Shop.title: Shop
Shop.description: Represents a shop registered on the platform.

ownerUserId.description: Reference to the User who owns the shop. (Relationship: Shop 1:1 User)

deliveryChargeDefault.description: Default delivery charge for the shop.

currency.description: Currency used by the shop (e.g., USD, EUR).

taxRate.description: Tax rate applied by the shop.

status.description: Status of the shop (active, pending, blocked).

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the shop was created.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the platform (shop owner, staff, or customer).

role.description: Role of the user (owner, staff, customer).

shopId.description: Reference to the Shop the user belongs to. Nullable for customers. (Relationship: Shop 1:N User)

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the user was created.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product offered by a shop.

shopId.description: Reference to the Shop that offers the product. (Relationship: Shop 1:N Product)

sku.description: Stock keeping unit of the product.

images.description: Array of URLs to product images.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the product was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the product was last updated.

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a customer.

shopId.description: Reference to the Shop the order was placed with. (Relationship: Shop 1:N Order)

customerId.description: Reference to the User who placed the order. (Relationship: User 1:N Order)

items.description: Array of items in the order. Each item contains product details and quantity.

subtotal.description: Subtotal of the order (excluding tax and delivery charge).

orderStatus.description: Status of the order (Pending, Accepted, Preparing, Out for Delivery, Delivered, Cancelled, Refunded).

paymentStatus.description: Status of the payment for the order.

paymentMethod.description: Method of payment used for the order (Online Payment, COD).

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the order was created.

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when the order was last updated.

Payment.title: Payment
Payment.description: Represents a payment made for an order.

orderId.description: Reference to the Order the payment is for. (Relationship: Order 1:1 Payment)

transactionId.description: Transaction ID from the payment gateway.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the payment was created.

AuditLog.title: AuditLog
AuditLog.description: Represents an audit log entry for tracking user activities.

logId.description: Unique identifier for the audit log entry.

actorUserId.description: Reference to the User who performed the action. (Relationship: User 1:N AuditLog)

objectType.description: Type of object affected by the action (e.g., Product, Order).

objectId.description: Identifier of the object affected by the action.

timestamp.description: Timestamp when the action was performed.

metadata.description: Additional information about the action (e.g., details of the change).

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support a multi-shop, multi-user application with features like shop registration, product and order management, staff activity logging, and reporting. The design prioritizes authorization independence by denormalizing authorization data to avoid `get()` calls in security rules, and it ensures clear segregation of data for different access needs. 

Authorization Independence is achieved through denormalization. For instance, the `users/{userId}` collection, intended for user data, includes the `shopId` field, referencing the shop to which the user belongs. This duplication of the relationship eliminates the need to perform a `get()` operation to verify shop information on a user document, improving authorization independence.

To support the QAPs (Rules are not Filters) principle, we utilize structural segregation and membership maps:

*   **Shops and Products:** The `/shops/{shopId}` collection stores shop-related data. The `/shops/{shopId}/products/{productId}` subcollection stores products.  This allows shop owners to manage their own products without needing access to other shops' data.
*   **Users:** The `/users/{userId}` collection houses user data, including the user's `role` and `shopId`. This design enables role-based access control for different functionalities.
*   **Orders:** Orders are structured under the `/shops/{shopId}/orders/{orderId}` path, ensuring that orders are scoped to their respective shops. This facilitates secure `list` operations, as each shop can only access its own order data.
*   **Audit Logs:** Audit logs are stored in the `/audit_logs/{logId}` collection, capturing user activities across the platform. Each log entry includes the `actorUserId`, `action`, `objectType`, and `objectId`, enabling detailed tracking of user actions and changes made to data.

This structure enables robust security rules, facilitating the implementation of DBAC (Database-Based Access Control) without relying on custom claims. Furthermore, it aligns with the principles of data clarity and predictability, using explicit state modeling (e.g., `orderStatus` field) and consistent naming conventions.
